definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The first commercially contracted re-supply mission to the International Space Station (ISS) has begun.
sentences.chinese: 对国际空间站的首个商业化补给任务已经开始实行。

sentences.english: "The Premier League is the best-marketed league in the world, " he added.
sentences.chinese: “英超联赛是世界上最好商业化联赛，”他补充道。

sentences.english: Objective To lay a solid technological foundation of large-scale commercialized production of Quwencao.
sentences.chinese: 目的为驱蚊草进行大规模的商业化生产打下技术基础。
商业化的图书充斥市场。

sentences.english: He adds that the commercialisation of genetically modified (GM) crops requires this law.
sentences.chinese: 他还说，转基因作物的商业化需要这部法律。

sentences.english: It's a very new technology so nobody has picked it up and commercialised it.
sentences.chinese: 这是一项非常新的技术，还未被完全发掘并商业化。

sentences.english: But that commercialization has spoiled the day for many.
sentences.chinese: 但商业化很大程度上，破坏了这个节日。

sentences.english: Some of the commercially produced venison resembles beef in flavour.
sentences.chinese: 有些商业化养殖的鹿肉味道和牛肉很相似。

sentences.english: It's a breath of fresh air on the newsstands filled with over-commercialized magazines.
sentences.chinese: 它是新鲜的空气弥漫着过度商业化杂志的报摊气息。

sentences.english: Hanshan Temple, too commercial, don't like it.
sentences.chinese: 第一站到寒山寺，很商业化，不喜欢。

sentences.english: At SUCO most commercially-available connector system can be supplied.
sentences.chinese: 在苏克最商业化的连接器系统可以提供。

sentences.english: It isn't wise to commercialize sport.
sentences.chinese: 把体育运动商业化并不明智。

sentences.english: The trade and the mammonism seriously corrodes the society lives each stratification plane.
sentences.chinese: 商业化及拜金主义严重侵蚀着社会生活各个层面。

sentences.english: Pong was the first commercial video game to reach pop consciousness.
sentences.chinese: “乒乓”是第一款流行的商业化视频游戏。

sentences.english: Even so, Girvin admits that the work is far from being commercialized.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，基尔文承认这项成果还远不能商业化。

sentences.english: His new record is much too commercial.
sentences.chinese: 他的新唱片太商业化了。

definition: minority of the population/non-mainstream (activity, pursuit etc)/niche (market etc)
to extend/to spread/to popularize/generalization/promotion (of a product etc)
to be in operation/to do business/(of train, bus etc) to be in service/operation/service
industry chain (concept proposed by US scholar Michael Porter in 1985)
